It's not too loud of a place (at least on a Tuesday night) to foster intimate conversation.   For dinner I followed the menu's guidance (and then asked Wally himself). Chicken Vesuvius is w-o-n-d-e-r-f-u-l! Chicken medallions, artichoke hearts, kalamata olives, 'cider' smoked bacon (HOH MY) with plenty of herbs and spices. My meal was served with a hearty portion of salad and (HOH MY) horse radish mashed potatoes.  1) The chicken was cooked to perfection. Not a hint of dryness! 2) The chicken wasn't bathed in oil. That sounds like a terrible way to describe it, but, I didn't feel like I was tossing a gym session out the window.   That being said, note that portions are on the very [very] generous side. I took 2/3rd of it home.  Right. So about Wally, the impeccable service and a delightful experience... Let's see...Our server described the specials with such delight that I only wished I was going off menu. But no! I wanted something "regular" on the menu. Wally was incredibly helpful in helping this first timer navigate the full menu. (Alas, the house was out of the nightly special of ribs.) Wally has a comedic sense of timing. Watch out!  Ok, so what's the deal with Wally's fantastic beard? Were you thinking Ernest Hemingway? Why yes! In fact, Wally and his son enter a contest every year for the best E. Hemingway beard in FL.   [Drum Roll] They are 2013 crowned winners!  This is a great spot if you're popping in to AJ's. Loved it!

I had lunch at Wally's on a day when I wanted to eat healthier--- let's just say, that day was shot I had to call for a do-over the next day.  But oh, my Wally Burger was good!   Very laid back and easy going, I will return.  It's been awhile, but I will return.   We sat on the patio and I really enjoyed the casual-ness.  It's hidden, so you  have to go look for it.  44th/Camelback on the NE corner shopping center.   See you there!

Great salad dressing, wonderful escargot appetizer with blue cheese, scrumptious Prime Rb, with marvelous mashed potatoes and great gelato. You can't beat this place for food, value, service, and ambiance.

I have been twice for happy hour. All their burgers are $7 during this time. I had one of the best veggie burgers I have ever had and definitely the best in the valley. My next visit I had the escargot with bleu cheese and it was delicious! I only wish the bread it was served with had been toasted otherwise it was perfect. I can't wait to visit the Gainey Village location.

The location is prime and the decor is neat, but the staff is horrendous! From the second we walked in we were treated as second class. The greeting with the hostess was odd but when the lack of communication continued things just felt uncomfortable. Severs would come to the table to drop something off or fill water, after saying thank you they'd look at me and turn walking away without saying a word. We noticed that it wasn't just one ill trained associate but every person there refused to say 'your welcome' or even acknowledge my expression of appreciation. We came to the conclusion that they must literally train their employees this way because every person in the establishment treated us this way. We paid with separate checks, and to top it off they charged the wrong cards. Meaning they literally had to take the card out of the opposite bill fold and charge it to the wrong check.   They seem to cater more toward the older crowd, as staff seemed extremely friendly with these patrons. The fact that we are both under the age of 40 seemed to have contributed to our poor treatment.   I can assure you I will not be returning and I urge you to save yourself an awful experience and dine or drink somewhere else as well!

Where everybody knows your name.  Very refreshing to be waited on by Wally himself, I'll come back for the we serve mostly "regulars" feeling you get.  I don't think enough people know about this place but those that do come back for more.  The Cuban is my lunch of choice and the beer selection is perfect for happy hour.

My family and I are regulars at Wally's because at Wally's, regulars are family.  Beyond the deep, deep personal connection I have with the restaurant I can tell you that the food is unquestionably great and the service is always top-notch. (There are a few servers and bartenders who have been there since the place opened 10 years ago.)   My favorite menu items are as follows: 1) Cuban Panini 2) Frisco Burger 3) Meatloaf 4) Pot Roast 5) Spaghetti. The fact that Wally's can do all five of those things extremely well should tell you all you need to know.  There is something old school cool about a joint where the Proprietor is almost always present and Wally's is that place. He's the guy with the grey hair and beard who probably handed you your menu. Tell him I said hello and that the Price family loves him like their own.

First time here at Wally's! I got a bacon cheddar burger and my dad got a Havana Cuban sandwich ! So good! I personally wasn't a fan of the sweet potato fries, but was very happy with the meal also loved the atmosphere. Although our waitress was visibly irritated with the kitchen timer. Kind of a downer. But great place!

YUM!  We live 45 minutes away from here and still have to come at least 1-2 times a month.  Good prices, fresh food, great tastes!  The blue plate specials are awesome.   Prime Rib is always on point!
Cheeseburger S'mac is THE BOMB. Granted, it's the only thing I've tried there so far but I am going to be back for more!

My husband and I stopped in this restraurant recently where my husband has been to to watch sports but this was my first visit. We don't live close but we will definitely make the trip back soon. I had the prime rib special and it was flavorful and tender. My husband had the liver since I won't cook it. He enjoyed his meal as well.    We found the staff professional but very friendly and the service excellent and quick.

Group of 6 popped in on a busy Friday night at 7:00.... Never been here before. Greeted like we were old friend and we were told a table could be found in a few minutes. We complicated it by asking for a table with a view of the TV for the baseball game viewers in the group. Wow... Seated within 4 minutes and lovely server who knew the menu well took great care of us. Highlights.... Everyone loved what they got... Onion soup, yum-o, s-Mac n cheese... Had the Gruyere and bacon version, wow! Would definitely order again and drive out of our way for it!  Pot roast.... Great atmosphere, reasonable prices, great service and great food.  Yay!

This has been on my "to try" list for ages. We live down the street, we need a watering hole, and most importantly one that allows dogs. We found it. I almost don't want to shout out the rave reviews too loudly because it's so cool and I don't want to attract any uncool-ness with rave reviews. But I do want to give props to a terrific establishment.  The interior is beautiful, I love the lofty feel over the bar. The crowd was a nice mix and good representation of our Arcadia hood. Not too rowdy, not too stiff. The ambiance was set up very well, with a little sports flair but casual dining as well away from TVs.  The waitstaff is attentive and genuine. The food was above-average pub fare with plenty of veg options for us meatless mongers. The only minus was that while the patio allows dogs, not ALL areas of the patio are dog friendly according to our host. So we had to sit away from the bulk of table and couldn't sit under the heaters (which also apparently couldn't be moved). It was 50* out and pretty chilly, so I'll plan for that next time.

Wally's is great, been going there for years.  It is super-close to home and is consistently good.    It is indeed a "pub n grill," just like the name says.  American food done well, a great bar, and the patio is the best.  Since it opened, Wally's has been one of our regular spots.  Long live Wally's!

Well what can I say.  Great atmosphere.  Good Pub style food.  Cold drinks and a cantankerous owner!  My wife and I have been coming here for years and they always do a great job.    Food is consistently excellent with good portions and the fries are always perfect.  Wally's son Matt has been hosting the place more lately, so be sure to ask him why he's so much less cantankerous than his old man?  It's nice to see a family business do well as they all work hard every time you walk in the door to make sure you're welcome and that you're happy with everything.  Cheers

I come here when I know I want to have some really good food. I've been to this place quite a few times and every single time every meal I've ordered has been beyond flavorful and delicious. I often have a hard time choosing what I want to eat. They have a huge variety of food anywhere from sandwiches to pasta to steak. It's priced perfect for the quality and quantity you're given. Every single staff member here is friendly, and they go above and beyond to make sure you're having a pleasant experience while dining there. This is overall the best restaurant in Phoenix. (I would highly recommend the meatball sandwich or a Wally burger)

I was expecting this place to be better than it was based on reviews. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to my expectations. The burgers were just "ok" - nothing special and nothing great. Actually, both my husband and I ordered the bacon cheese burger and BOTH of us originally thought they had forgotten the cheese. It ended up being there, but was such a small amount that you couldn't even taste it. Our daughters had the chicken fingers, which were pretty good, but also not anything phenomenal. Probably the best part of the meal were the sauces. The BBQ sauce on my burger (I got it "rodeo style" - with BBQ and onion strings) was really tasty, and the ranch that the chicken was served with was delicious. Tasted really fresh and homemade - they should bottle and sell that stuff! The burgers? Meh - I could take it or leave it. Certainly not worth a special out-of-your-way trip or anything.
